        borderWidth: 3

    // Function to show data points on the radar chart
    function showDataPoint() {
      // Check if there are still elements in the array
      if (real_values.length > 0 || real_values.length > 0) {
        // Get a random index within the range of the values array
        var randomIndex = Math.floor(Math.random() * real_values.length);
        
        // Get the value at the random index
        var valueR = real_values[randomIndex];
        var valueP = predicted_values[randomIndex];

        // Remove the selected value from the array
        real_values.splice(randomIndex, 1);
        predicted_values.splice(randomIndex, 1);

        // Find the index of the label corresponding to the angle value
        var indexR = data.labels.indexOf(valueR);
        var indexP = data.labels.indexOf(valueP);

        // Add data point to the correct position in the datasets
        radarChart.data.datasets[0].data[indexR] += 1; // Real Azimuthal Values
        radarChart.data.datasets[1].data[indexP] += 1; // Predicted Azimuthal Values
        radarChart.update();
      } else {
        // If the array is empty, stop the interval
        clearInterval(interval);
      }
    }

    // Call showDataPoint every second
    var interval = setInterval(function() {
      showDataPoint();
    }, 100); // Adjust interval (in milliseconds) as needed
